## Background
Phylogenetic Comparative Analysis or Phylogentic Comparative Methods (PCMs) are a set of statistical methods that are used by biologist, geneticist, and anthropologists to analyze phylogenetic trees and track/presents species traits (Pennell & Harmon, 2013). The purpose of this method is to utilize the phylogenetic trees to address the evolutionary hypotheses and diversification of species.
